trans-unit.source: Places a message in the message queue and then returns

seg-source.mrk: Places a message in the message queue and then returns

target.mrk: Places a message in the message queue and then returns

trans-unit.source: Identifies the window whose window procedure will receive the message.

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the window whose window procedure will receive the message.

target.mrk: Identifies the window whose window procedure will receive the message.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0xFFFF (HWND_BROADCAST), the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0xFFFF (HWND_BROADCAST), the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0xFFFF (HWND_BROADCAST), the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system, including disabled or invisible windows, overlapped windows, and pop-up windows; but the message is not sent to child windows.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the message to be sent

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the message to be sent

target.mrk: Specifies the message to be sent

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

target.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information
